questions.text: Which of the following is diagnostic of plasma cell hemolysis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: Postulated cell of origin of osteoclastoma is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

choices.text: Reduction in uterine size after pregnancy
Muscle atrophy due to prolonged bed rest
Decrease in thymic size with aging
Neuronal loss due to normal aging

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of atrophy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Muscle atrophy due to prolonged bed rest. Reduction in uterine size after pregnancy is reversal of hypertrophy to normal.

questions.text: Which of the following is false about in nephrotic syndrome I. RAAS activation II. Increased hydrostatic pressure III. Decreased GFR IV. Decreased oncotic pressure V. Decreased lipoproteins
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: A 48-year-old male presents with chronic diarrhea, weight loss, arthralgia, and intermittent fever. On physical examination, he has hyperpigmentation of the skin and generalized lymphadenopathy. Intestinal biopsy is as given below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Histology shows foamy macrophages in lamina propria which is characteristic of Whipple disease.

questions.text: Which of the following is not an immune mediated transfusion complication?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

TACO is volume overload after blood transfusion thus not an immune mediated reaction.

questions.text: A 22-year-old man is having right lower quadrant abdominal pain over the past day. On physical examination there is rebound tenderness on palpation over the right lower quadrant. Laparoscopic surgery is performed, and the appendix is swollen and red, histology sows dense neutrophilic infiltrate in the appendix. Which of the following mediators has led to clinical manifestation of the patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The patient is having appendicitis and the clinical features [pain and tenderness] or due to PG E2 and bradykinin.

choices.text: Induces secretion of heparin like molecules

questions.text: Mechanism of action of protein C in normal hemostasis is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Protein C induces lysis of Factor V

choices.text: Metastatic deposits in the right ventricle myocardium

questions.text: A 69-year-old woman with a 7 kg weight loss over the past 6 months was diagnosed of carcinoma head of the pancreas, along with widespread nodules in the liver. Nodules are seen in both lungs by chest radiograph. Which of the following cardiac abnormalities is she most likely to develop?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Nonbacterial thrombotic endocarditis. Pancreatic carcinoma is a known risk for thrombosis (paraneoplastic syndrome) which can lead to Nonbacterial thrombotic endocarditis.

questions.text: A 23-year-old woman has presented with headache not relieved by NSAIDs for last few weeks now she is having diminished vision. Physical examination revealed 6th and 8th nerve palsy. Fundoscopy revealed bilateral papilledema and increased in retinal vessels which are dilated tortuous. Imaging of brain shows a tumor in the cerebellum. The patients father died of a metastatic renal cell carcinoma. Which mutation is likely to be seen in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

VHL. The patient is having a retinal angioma by description on fundoscopy and a cerebellar tumor (? hemangioblastoma) in addition patients father had a renal cell carcinoma suggests that the patient is having an inherited cancer syndrome suggestive of a Von Hippel Lindau syndrome. Option A is associated with Schwannoma and meningioma. Option C is associated with subependymal giant cell astrocytoma, cortical tubers and angiomyolipoma of kidney. option D is seen in Gorlin Syndrome and is associate with medulloblastoma and basal cell carcinoma

choices.text: I, II, III, IV are true

questions.text: True about markers of lung carcinoma I. TTF-1 is negative in squamous cell carcinoma II. Napsin A is positive in adenocarcinoma III. P40 & p63 are positive in Squamous cell carcinoma IV. Chromogranin is positive in small cell carcinoma V. Adenocarcinomas are positive for CK7 and negative for CK 20.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All are true

questions.text: Which of the following marker will be helpful in differentiating Thymoma and Thymic T-ALL/LBL
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cytokeratin. CK is positive in Thymoma and negative in TALL. CD3,10, Tdt and CD34 will be positive in TALL and also background lymphocytes in thymomas.

choices.text: Polyoma virus infection of the graft

questions.text: A pathologist finds homogenous inclusions in epithelial cells in urine in a 47-year-old who underwent a renal allograft 2 years ago as shown in the figure. Likely diagnosis is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Image shows homogeneous intra nuclear inclusions in the epithelial cells also known as decoy cells which is characteristic of polyoma BK virus infection.

questions.text: Which of the following conditions can have increased serum ferritin I. Thalassemia II. Megaloblastic anemia III. Sideroblastic anemia IV. Anemia of chronic disease
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: A Punjabi couple is seeking genetic counselling for an inherited anemia, although both of them do not have any anemia, but the blood investigations show microcytic hypochromic picture. HPLC finding of husband is HbA 92%, HbA2 7%, HbF1% and wife HbA-94.5%, HbA2 4.5% HbF 1%. What is the likely hood of them having a child born with inherited anemia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

25%. Husband and wife both are thalassemia carriers by their HbA2 levels thus the chance of child having a disease is 25%.

questions.text: Given below are three oxygen dissociation curves, which of the following is true about these?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Storage of blood in blood bank reduces 23 DPG thus O2 dissociation curve shifts to left. ACD has height shift to left addition of phosphate (CPD) increased 23DPG thus curve shifts slightly to right.

questions.text: Which of the following free radicals is most reactive?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Hydroxyl radical (OH•). Hydroxyl anion is the most potent free radical and superoxide anion is a least potent free radical.

questions.text: Renal biopsy from a patient is shown as below what is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Image shows onion skin proliferation of smooth muscle in the vessel wall which is characteristic of malignant hypertension.

questions.text: Lady had a needle prick following which this is the physical appearance which of the following is true
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The clinical image use of hypertrophic scar [scar is beyond the wound margin]. In hypertrophic scar type one collagen is more but it is haphazardly arranged thus the strength is not high

questions.text: A 30-year-old lady is planned for a fistulectomy. Preoperative screening shows Elevated Clotting time and APTT. But she has no complaints of bleeding. Physical examination is within normal limits. Which of the following investigation will help in arriving at diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Asymptomatic lady with elevated APTT is suggestive of Antiphospholipid antibodies.

questions.text: Fungal cell walls are best demonstrated by
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Gomori Methionamine silver is the best stain for fungal cell wall.

questions.text: A patient presents with easy fatigue, examination shows hepatosplenmegaly. CBC shows Hb 9, TLC 3000, platelet 30000. Bone marrow aspirate yields no cells. Which of the following is unlikely cause such presentation
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The patient has pancytopenia with hepatosplenomegaly and dry tap on BMA. aplastic anemia doesnot cause hepatosplenomegaly

choices.text: Arborising network of smooth muscle dissecting through the glands
Cystically dilated glands filled with mucus and inflammatory debris
Villous architecture with saw tooth appearance

questions.text: A 5-year-old child presents with painless rectal bleeding and occasional prolapse of a polypoid mass during defecation. Colonoscopy reveals a solitary polyp in the rectum. Histopathological examination confirms a juvenile polyp. What is the most likely histological finding in this polyp?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cystically dilated glands filled with mucus and inflammatory debris

questions.text: A child is born with a single functional allele of a tumor suppressor gene. At the age of five the remaining normal allele is lost through a point mutation. As a result, the ability to inhibit cell cycle progression to S phase is lost. Which of the following neoplasms is most likely to arise via this mechanism?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

loss of inhibition to progress to S phase (means loss of regulation in G1-S progression) which is due to Rb.

questions.text: The pathogenesis of late phase of asthma is primarily mediated by
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Major Basic protein. Histamine leads to early phase of asthma which is characterised by bronchoconstriction, increased mucus secretion. The late phase is characterised by epithelial cell destruction, increased mucus and increased cells at the bronchus is mediated by major basic protein and eosinophilic cationic proteins

questions.text: Which of the following is an absolutely required criteria for diagnosis of polycythaemia vera I. Hb >16.5 in men II. BM showing increased erythroid cells III. JAK 2 mutation
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

JAK 2 is a major criteria but is not must for diagnosis of PCV (it is negative in 5-10% cases)

questions.text: Silver-stained renal biopsy from a patient suffering from hematuria is as follows. Immunofluorescence shows deposits of IgG, C1, C3. What is likely diagnosis
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The image shows tram track appearance which is seen in MPGN and IF shows deposits of IgG, C1 and C3 that is seen in type I. type II MPGN (dense deposit disease will show only complement deposits.

questions.text: The terms variable expressivity and reduced penetrance are often used in which of the following type of inheritance
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Variable expressivity is varied manifestation in different people carrying the same mutation and reduced penetrance is no manifestation of disease despite carrying mutation both of these are seen in autosomal dominant disorders.

questions.text: Anticoagulant used in the following vacutainer is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Grey vacutainer have potassium oxalate as anticoagulant and Sodium Fluoride as preservative (glycolysis inhibitor)

questions.text: In a chronic smoker which of the following cellular adaptations are most likely to happen in the esophagus
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Smoking is a risk factor for GERD which leads to columnar (intestinal) metaplasia in esophagus, smoking also frequently leads to squamous metaplasia in respiratory tract.

questions.text: Haematological manifestations of lupus are which type of hypersensitivity
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Lupus [SLE] causes vasculitis which is type 3 hypersensitivity reaction which leads to manifestation and most of the organs including lung, heart, liver, kidney, skin, joint. The hematological manifestations of lupus viz autoimmune hemolytic anemia [AIHA] and immune thrombocytopenic purpura [IPT] are type 2 hypersensitivity reactions.

questions.text: Liver biopsy of a child suffering from hepatitis is as follows. Which of the following extra hepatic complications is expected in him in the future?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The image shows PAS positive globules in the hepatocyte characteristic of alpha 1 anti-trypsin deficiency which will have Pan acinar emphysema and MPGN type I as complication apart from hepatitis and cirrhosis.

questions.text: A patient presents with anemia and hyperpigmented knuckles following gastrectomy, likely diagnosis
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Hyperpigmented knuckles are seen in vitamin B12 deficiency which can occur after gastrectomy.

questions.text: Neoplasm arising from/ having differentiation to myelin producing cells of central nervous system are known as
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Which of the following Changes happen in neutrophil extracellular trap [NET]
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

In NET there is activation of arginine deaminase which converts arginine into citrulline in the histones leading to chromatin de-condensation.

questions.text: HbH is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

HbH is seen in alpha thalassemia in which there are beta tetramers

questions.text: Which of the following tumors shows a perineural spread
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: A 45-year female has weight loss, imaging shows micronodules with perihilar opacities in lung. Biopsy from one of the involved lymph node is as follows. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The image shows descrete bare granulomas which is characteristic of sarcoidosis.

questions.text: Histological examination of an ovarian tumor is as follows. What marker is likely to be positive?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The image shows call exner bodies characteristically seen in granulosa cell tumor.

questions.text: Which of the following is scenario the qualifies as AML I. Blast 22% without any genetic abnormalities II. Blasts 15% with t(9;22) III. Blasts 12% with t(15;17) IV. Blasts 15% with NMP-1 mutaion
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: Histological examination of a testicular tumor in a 30-year male is as follows what is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Clear cytoplasm with lymphocytic infiltrate is characteristic of seminoma.

questions.text: Opisthorchis sinensis infection leads to which of the following malignancy
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C).

questions.text: A young patient died of cardiac arrhythmia and cross section of heart appears as follows at autopsy what is likely cause
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The image shows dilation of Right ventricle and RV muscle is replaced by fat seen in Arrhythmogenic Right ventricular dilated cardiomyopathy.

questions.text: Cryoprecipitate does not contain which of the following factor
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Contents of cryoprecipitate are options A,B,C and VwD.

questions.text: A male infant is born at term. No congenital anomalies are noted on examination. A year later he now has failure to thrive and has been getting one bacterial pneumonia after another with both Hemophilus influenzae and Streptococcus pneumoniae cultured from his sputum. Which of the following disease is most likely in this child?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

It is not (A) because no congenital anomalies are noted, it is not (B) because will have only superficial mucosal infections like diarrhoea and not pneumonia, it is not (D) because not thrombocytopenia and eczema which are usually seen in it.

questions.text: MEN 1 syndrome is due to
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Peripheral smear of a patient is as shown below, what is likely diagnosis
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The image shows clumping of RBC which is seen in cold AIHA.

questions.text: Which of the following disease follows the pattern of inheritance shown in the image
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Rett Syndrome. The image shows Dominant pattern and transmission from father to daughter is 100% while father to son is 0% so X linked dominant.

choices.text: Decreased ATP production per glucose molecule
Rapid biosynthesis of macromolecules for cell growth

questions.text: The metabolic advantage provided by the Warburg effect in cancer cells includes:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The advantages of Warburg effect is synthesis of molecules like Nucleic acid, amino acids required for cell growth.

questions.text: Histological examination of diffuse thyroid swelling is as follows. Likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The image shows lymphocytic infiltrate and hurthle cells within thyroid seen in Hashimoto thyroiditis.
